item.title: Emily add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Emily add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I remember her telling me once that rabbits were the gnomes in attendance to the Fairy Queen and that the stars were God's daisy chain. Perfect rot, of course." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Emily add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "You would not enjoy Nietzsche, sir. He is fundamentally unsound." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Emily add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "What's the use of a great city having temptations if fellows don't yield to them?" -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Emily add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Oh, I don't know, you know, don't you know?" -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Emily add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "I believe that we learn by practice. Whether it means to learn to dance by practicing dancing or to learn to live by practicing living, the principles are the same. In each, it is the performance of a dedicated precise set of acts, physical or intellectual, from which comes shape of achievement, a sense of one's being, a satisfaction of spirit. One becomes, in some area, an athlete of God. Practice means to perform, over and over again in the face of all obstacles, some act of vision, of faith, of desire. Practice is a means of inviting the perfection desired." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Emily add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "What people in the world think of you is really none of your business." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dorothy Sayers
item.description: "A facility for quotation covers the absence of original thought." -- Dorothy Sayers

item.title: Emily add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "It takes a lot of time to be a genius. You have to sit around so much, doing nothing, really doing nothing." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "If you can't say anything nice about anyone else, come sit next to me." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Blind belief in authority is the greatest enemy of truth." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer somebody else up." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Never memorize something that you can look up." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Dancers are the athletes of God." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Studs Terkel
item.description: "I always love to quote Albert Einstein because nobody dares contradict him." -- Studs Terkel

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Somebody who only reads newspapers and at best books of contemporary authors looks to me like an extremely near-sighted person who scorns eyeglasses. He is completely dependent on the prejudices and fashions of his times, since he never gets to see or hear anything else." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It is, in fact, nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction have not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry; for this delicate little plant, aside from stimulation, stands mainly in need of freedom. Without this it goes to wrack and ruin without fail." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Emily add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "Out of a human population on earth of four and a half billion, perhaps twenty people can write a book in a year. Some people lift cars, too. Some people enter week-long sled-dog races, go over Niagara Falls in a barrel, fly planes through the Arc de Triomphe. Some people feel no pain in childbirth. Some people eat cars. There is no call to take human extremes as norms." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I hate writing, I love having written." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Emily add a quote by Kalu Ndukwe Kalu
item.description: "The things you do for yourself are gone when you are gone, but the things you do for others remain as your legacy." -- Kalu Ndukwe Kalu

item.title: Emily add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love." -- Anonymous
